title: Mister Buddwing [1966 - USA] (James Garner) drama
description:
Mister Buddwing (1966 - USA)

Drama

director . . . . Delbert Mann
starring . . . . James Garner, Jean Simmons, Suzanne Pleshette
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0059453/


Academy Awards Oscar - 2 NOMINATIONS - Best Art Direction and Best Costume Design

Mr Buddwing wakes up in Central Park with total amnesia. All he has to go on are the items he finds upon his person. Using these he goes in search of who he is. Mister Buddwing is one of those films that are on the cusp between film noir and neo-noir. Sort of a psychological noir rather than a crime noir. A melancholy film that plays with time, space and your mind as the various vignettes overlap, it is eerie and noirishly suspenseful, but at times darkly comic. It requires multiple viewings to fully comprehend and provides a must see portrait of New York City on the cusp of the Swinging Sixties.
